required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stapes Footplate Thickness Measured With UHR-CT
clinical_study.official_title: Stapes Footplate Thickness Measured With UHR-CT

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare the thickness of the stapes footplate measured with ultra high resolution CT in control patients, otosclerosis patients and chronic otitis media patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Stapes footplate thickness will be measured under its anterior crus, its posterior crus and at its midpoint, in both the stapes axial plane and the laletral semi-circular canal planes.

primary_outcome.measure: stapes footplate thickness in mm in the stapes axial plane
primary_outcome.description: stapes footplate thickness measured with a digital caliper on our PACS system with the accuracy of a tenth of a millimetre, under the anterior crus of the stapes, under the posterior crus of the stapes, and at its midpoint, in the stapes axial plane and in the lateral semi circular canal plane, to compare both values and find out wich one is the most pertinent

arm_group.description: otitis media with middle ear opacities
sudden ear loss, pre-implantatory imaging, vertigo, tympanic perforation

study_pop.textblock: patients refered to our department between october 2020 and October 2022 for an ultra high resolution CT of the temporal bone

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ultra high resolution CT of the temporal bone available
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous surgery

reference.citation: Akazawa Y, Ganaha A, Higa T, Kondo S, Oyakawa Y, Hirakawa H, Suzuki M, Yamashiro T. Measurement of stapes footplate thickness in otosclerosis by ultra-high-resolution computed tomography. Acta Otolaryngol. 2020 Nov;140(11):899-903. doi: 10.1080/00016489.2020.1788225. Epub 2020 Jul 23.

Tang R, Yin H, Wang Z, Zhang Z, Zhao L, Zhang P, Li J, Zhao P, Lv H, Zhang L, Yang Z, Wang Z. Stapes visualization by ultra-high resolution CT in cadaveric heads: A preliminary study. Eur J Radiol. 2021 Aug;141:109786. doi: 10.1016/j.ejrad.2021.109786. Epub 2021 May 21.
